intro: Fleurya interrupta, commonly known as the interrupted fleurya, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale pink. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
